title: 114_s1428
content: The Act is titled the "Excess Uranium Transparency and Accountability Act." It pertains to uranium transfers and sales. The USEC Privatization Act is amended to define depleted uranium, highly enriched uranium, and low-enriched uranium. The USEC Privatization Act is amended to define various terms related to uranium, including natural uranium, off-spec uranium, and metric ton of uranium. The USEC Privatization Act is amended to define terms related to uranium, including uranium hexafluoride (UF6), which is a compound of uranium and fluorine that can exist as a solid, liquid, or gas depending on conditions. The Secretary is restricted from providing enrichment services or transferring/selling uranium without following the regulations outlined in the Act. Additionally, a Federal excess uranium management plan must be issued by the Secretary every 10 years starting from January 1, 2017. The inventory management plan outlines the management of excess uranium inventories of the Department of Energy for at least 10 years, covering various forms of uranium. It also includes steps to minimize the impact on domestic uranium industries when transferring or selling uranium. The Secretary must publish a proposed plan in the Federal Register within 180 days of enactment, outlining steps to maximize the value of uranium for the Federal Government, including actions requiring new authority. The Secretary must publish a proposed plan within 180 days of enactment to maximize the value of uranium for the Federal Government, including actions requiring new authority. Amendments include deadlines for final plans and revisions to subsections for clarity. The Secretary may transfer, sell, or provide uranium from the Department of Energy stockpile with limitations on the amount annually until 2023. From 2024 onwards, a new limit will be enforced. The Secretary is restricted from transferring more than 2,700 metric tons of various forms of uranium annually, with specific determinations required before any transfer is made. Before making a determination, the Secretary must publish a proposed determination in the Federal Register. Any market analysis prepared by the Department of Energy for the Secretary must undergo a peer review process to ensure quality and objectivity. Beginning on January 1, 2021, the Secretary's determination requirement for transferring, selling, or providing uranium will be waived if the uranium is listed in the updated long-term Federal excess uranium inventory management plan. In subsection (g), the reference to subsection (d)(2) is changed to subsection (f)(2).
